action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A black and white photo of two people standing on a busy street, looking upwards. There is a casino sign visible in the background.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: A box of donuts is placed on a dining table, with a clear view of two plates containing pastries, one of which is located on the right side and the other on the left side of the box. There is also a knife visible near the plates.

This is my DESCRIPTION: A black and white photo of two people standing on a busy street, looking upwards. There is a casino sign visible in the background.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any pastries visible in your image?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A box of donuts is placed on a dining table, with a clear view of two plates containing pastries, one of which is located on the right side and the other on the left side of the box. There is also a knife visible near the plates.
QUESTION: Are there any pastries visible in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any people in your image?

ANSWER: No

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the image in color or black and white?

QUESTION: Is the image in color or black and white? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your image depict an indoors or outdoors scene?

ANSWER: Black and white
QUESTION: Does your image depict an indoors or outdoors scene? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any objects on top of the dining table in your image?

ANSWER: Indoors
QUESTION: Are there any objects on top of the dining table in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Can you see a box of donuts in your image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Can you see a box of donuts in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
